result.execSummary:
The defendant David Arnold Belille Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $443 costs.    DEF MUST PROVIDE DNA SAMPLE and pay applicable $ 200 surcharge which is included in these costs.

judgments.dispoDesc: DE pleads No Contest to Ct #1, found Guilty.  Sentence imposed: 9 months county jail concurrent with prison sentence in 14CF151.  Costs $443.    Pay obligation within 30 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.    Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge.
judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
